cscie97.asn4.housemate.entitlement

Class EntitlementServiceAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie97.asn4.housemate.entitlement.EntitlementServiceAPI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEntitlementServiceAPI

    public class EntitlementServiceAPI
extends java.lang.Object
implements IEntitlementServiceAPI
    Concrete implementation class of the EntitlementServiceAPI. Administrators may use the methods here to create and administer new Roles, Permissions, Resources, and Users, and also define the properties on each. Also contains methods for logging in and logging out, which enable registered users to call restricted interface methods on the IEntitlementServiceAPI, IHouseMateModelServiceAPI, and cscie97.asn4.housemate.controller.IHouseMateConrollerServiceAPI classes.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static IEntitlementServiceAPI getInstance()
        Returns a reference to the single static instance of the EntitlementServiceAPI. Will also create a "root user" account that can be used for loading all the Entitlement service items.
        Returns:
        singleton instance of EntitlementServiceAPI

      • addResource

        public void addResource(java.lang.String tokenID,
               Resource resource)
        Adds a new Resource definition. Resources can contain child permissions, but primarily serve as a marker class to group permissions into sets.
        Specified by:
        addResource in interface IEntitlementServiceAPI
        Parameters:
        tokenID - id of the AccessToken to use for entitlement to execute this method
        resource - the Resource object to add to the Entitlement service

      • addRole

        public void addRole(java.lang.String tokenID,
           Role role)
        Adds a new Role. Roles may contain other Roles or Permissions to define logical groupings that correspond to types of Users that may use the EntitlementServiceAPI.
        Specified by:
        addRole in interface IEntitlementServiceAPI
        Parameters:
        tokenID - id of the AccessToken to use for entitlement to execute this method
        role - the Role object to add to the Entitlement service

        Parameters:
        tokenID - id of the AccessToken to use for entitlement to execute this method
        userID - the pre-existing User ID to add the Entitlement to

      • login

        public AccessToken login(java.lang.String username,
                java.lang.String password)
                  throws AccessDeniedException
        Logs a user into the EntitlementService. Modifies the AccessToken of the User to expire in 1 hour.
        Specified by:
        login in interface IEntitlementServiceAPI
        Parameters:
        username - the username to validate
        password - the user's password to validate
        Returns:
        the AccessToken of the user
        Throws:
        AccessDeniedException - thrown if the credentials passed are invalid

      • logout

        public void logout(java.lang.String tokenID)
        Logs the User out that owns the AccessToken with the supplied ID. Modifies the AccessToken to set the expiration time to be now.
        Specified by:
        logout in interface IEntitlementServiceAPI
        Parameters:
        tokenID - the id of the AccessToken for the owning user

      • canAccess

        public boolean canAccess(java.lang.String tokenID,
                java.lang.String permissionID)
        Checks if the User that owns the AccessToken corresponding to the passed tokenID has permission to use the Permission. Looks up the AccessToken's owning User, and inspects their Entitlements to confirm whether or not the user has the corresponding Permission.
        Specified by:
        canAccess in interface IEntitlementServiceAPI
        Parameters:
        tokenID - the id of the AccessToken to check
        permissionID - the id of the Permission to check the user for
        Returns:
        true if the user has the Permission, false otherwise

      • canAccess

        public boolean canAccess(java.lang.String tokenID,
                PermissionType permissionType)
        Checks if the User that owns the AccessToken corresponding to the passed tokenID has permission to use the Permission. Looks up the AccessToken's owning User, and inspects their Entitlements to confirm whether or not the user has the corresponding Permission.
        Specified by:
        canAccess in interface IEntitlementServiceAPI
        Parameters:
        tokenID - the id of the AccessToken to check
        permissionType - the PermissionType to check the user for
        Returns:
        true if the user has the Permission, false otherwise

      • getInventory

        public java.lang.String getInventory()
        Returns a string representation of the entire Entitlements services, including Resources, Users, Roles, and Permissions. Uses the Visitor pattern to visit each Resource, User, Role, and Permission to inquire about the object's salient properties.
        Specified by:
        getInventory in interface IEntitlementServiceAPI
        Returns:
        string representation of the entire Entitlement services
